nl.helixsoft.util

Class URLParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.helixsoft.util.URLParser

  • public class URLParser
extends java.lang.Object
    Does the opposite of URLBuilder. This takes a URL as input, and splits it in parts.

    The part before '?' goes into base. The remaining string is split by '&' Every part is treated as a key-value pair with a '=' in between.

    For example:

    example.com/search?query=needle&case-sensitive=true

    Will give a base of 
    example.com/search
    And key value pairs of 
    query -> needle
    case-sensitive -> true
    The URL will be decoded.

    • Method Detail

      • getBase

        public java.lang.String getBase()

      • getParam

        public java.lang.String getParam(java.lang.String key)
        Parameters:
        key - the name of the parameter, for example "query"
        Returns:
        the value of the given parameter, or null if it wasn't present. Any URL-encoded characters such as '%20' will be decoded, in this case to a space character.
